item.title: Linear Regression Variational Approximation
item.description: For reference, a derivation of a variational approximation for linear regression following (Ormerod 2008) and (Ormerod and Wand 2010). Recall the evidence lower bound is given by \[ \begin{aligned} \ln p(y|\theta) &\geq \mathcal{L}(y|\theta;q) \\ &= \mathbb E_q[\ln p(y,\theta) - \ln q(\theta)] \\ &= \mathbb E_q[\ln p(y|\theta)] + \mathbb E_q[\ln p(\theta)] + \mathbb H_q[\theta]. \end{aligned} \] The model we are interested in is \[ \begin{aligned} y|\beta,\sigma^2 &\sim N(X\beta, \sigma^2 I_n) \\ \beta &\sim N(\mu_0,\Sigma_0) \\ \sigma^2 &\sim IG(a_0, b_0).
